required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study Exploring the Safety, Tolerability and Efficacy of a 4 Week Course of INCB018424 in Subjects With Active Rheumatoid Arthritis
clinical_study.official_title: A Double-blind, Placebo-controlled Study Exploring the Safety, Tolerability and Efficacy of a 4 Week Course of INCB018424 in Subjects With Active Rheumatoid Arthritis

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to understand the safety and tolerability of INCB018424 in patients with rheumatoid arthritis

primary_outcome.measure: The Percentage of Subjects Achieving American College of Rheumatology (ACR) 20 Improvement
primary_outcome.description: The ACR 20 is defined as ≥ 20% improvement in tender joint count plus ≥ 20% improvement in swollen joint count plus ≥ 20% improvement in 3 of the following 5 criteria: subject's assessment of pain, Subject's global assessment of disease activity (PGA), Physician's global assessment of disease activity (PHGA), subject's self-assessed disability Health Assessment Questionnaire (HAQ), and Erythrocyte sedimentation rate (ESR) or C-reactive protein (CRP), whichever shows the greatest change.

secondary_outcome.measure: The Percentage of Subjects Achieving ACR 50 Improvement
secondary_outcome.description: The ACR 50 is defined as ≥ 50% improvement in tender joint count plus ≥ 50% improvement in swollen joint count plus ≥50% improvement in 3 of the following 5 criteria: subject's assessment of pain, PGA, PHGA, subject's self-assessed disability HAQ, and ESR or CRP, whichever shows the greatest change.

secondary_outcome.measure: The Percentage of Subjects Achieving ACR 70 Improvement
secondary_outcome.description: The ACR 70 is defined as ≥ 70% improvement in tender joint count plus ≥ 70% improvement in swollen joint count plus ≥ 70% improvement in 3 of the following 5 criteria: subject's assessment of pain, PGA, PHGA, subject's self-assessed disability HAQ, and ESR or CRP, whichever shows the greatest change.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Disease Activity Score 28 (DAS 28) ESR Score
secondary_outcome.description: Calculation of the disease activity score 28 (DAS 28) score was based on the tender joint count, plus swollen joint count, plus PGA, plus Erythrocyte sedimentation rate (ESR). The DAS28-ESR is expressed as units on a scale with the minimum score=0 (best) to maximum score=10 (worst). Remission was defined as DAS28-ESR <2.6. The mean change from baseline (which represent decreases in the DAS 28 ESR scores) are shown as positive numbers in these analyses.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Disease Activity Score 28 (DAS 28) CRP Score
secondary_outcome.description: Calculation of the disease activity score 28 (DAS 28) score was based on the tender joint count, plus swollen joint count, plus PGA, plus C-reactive protein (CRP). A higher score indicated more disease activity. The mean change from baseline (which represent decreases in the DAS 28 CRP scores) are shown as positive numbers in these analyses. The DAS28 provides a score on a scale from 0 to 10 indicating the current activity of the rheumatoid arthritis (>5.1=high disease activity; <3.2=low disease activity; <2.6=remission).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects Who Achieved DAS 28 ESR Low Disease
secondary_outcome.description: Subjects who achieved low disease activity based on the DAS 28 ESR (score <3.2). Subjects who achieved low disease activity were classified as responders in this analysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects Who Achieved DAS 28 CRP Low Disease
secondary_outcome.description: Subjects who achieved low disease activity based on the DAS 28 CRP (score <3.2). Subjects who achieved low disease activity were classified as responders in this analysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects Who Achieved DAS 28 ESR Inactive Disease
secondary_outcome.description: Subjects who achieved inactive disease based on the DAS 28 ESR (score <2.6). Subjects who achieved low disease activity were classified as responders in this analysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects Who Achieved DAS 28 CRP Inactive Disease
secondary_outcome.description: Subjects who achieved inactive disease based on DAS 28 CRP (score <2.6). Subjects who achieved low disease activity were classified as responders in this analysis.

arm_group.description: INCB018424 15 mg twice daily (BID) or matching placebo
INCB018424 5 mg BID or matching placebo
INCB018424 25 mg BID or matching placebo
INCB018424 50 mg once daily (QD) or matching placebo

outcome.title: The Percentage of Subjects Achieving American College of Rheumatology (ACR) 20 Improvement
outcome.description: The ACR 20 is defined as ≥ 20% improvement in tender joint count plus ≥ 20% improvement in swollen joint count plus ≥ 20% improvement in 3 of the following 5 criteria: subject’s assessment of pain, Subject’s global assessment of disease activity (PGA), Physician’s global assessment of disease activity (PHGA), subject’s self-assessed disability Health Assessment Questionnaire (HAQ), and Erythrocyte sedimentation rate (ESR) or C-reactive protein (CRP), whichever shows the greatest change.
outcome.population: modified intent-to-treat (mITT) Population: subjects enrolled, took 1 dose of study drug, had predose and at least 1 post baseline Rheumatoid arthritis (RA) assessments. Subjects discontinuing before the last scheduled efficacy evaluation had data imputed for time points after discontinuation; they had their last observation carried forward (LOCF).

outcome.title: Percentage of Subjects Who Achieved DAS 28 ESR Low Disease
outcome.description: Subjects who achieved low disease activity based on the DAS 28 ESR (score <3.2). Subjects who achieved low disease activity were classified as responders in this analysis.
outcome.population: mITT Population: subjects who were enrolled, took at least 1 dose of study drug, and had predose and at least 1 post baseline Rheumatoid arthritis (RA) assessments. reported_events.time_frame: Adverse events were collected from the time the subject ingested the first dose of study drug up to 28 days after the last dose of study drug was administered.
reported_events.desc: Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events are those that either newly occurred after the first study drug dosing, or worsened from baseline

event.description: Congestive cardiac failure and Interstitial lung disease were reported in the same subject 3 weeks after the last dose of study medication and resolved 2 weeks later.
Congestive cardiac failure and Interstitial lung disease were reported in the same subject 3 weeks after the last dose of study medication and resolved 2 weeks later.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Following the first publication, the Institution and/or Principal Investigator may publish data or results from the Study, provided, however, that the Institution and/or Principal Investigator submits the proposed publication to the Sponsor for review at least sixty (60) days prior to the date of the proposed publication. Sponsor may remove from the proposed publication any information that is considered confidential and/or proprietary other than Study data and results.
